column4: It simply won't go away and synaptic won't work until it does!
what can i help you with?
what have you tried to do?  usually packages break when people try doing things to them, re-installs, removes things like that.
i don't know what to tell you then friend. =(
i searched for  package is in a very bad inconsistent state,  You should reinstall it before removing it.         on google
